candidates.title: Fix paths in release script, update crate versions
Speeding up comment-ltree migration, fixing index creation. Fixes #2664
Add feature to embed pictrs in lemmy binary (fixes #2627)
candidates.body: To try this, start lemmy with `cargo run --features embed-pictrs` and then start lemmy-ui. For now image uploads are failing with `thread 'actix-rt|system:0|arbiter:0' panicked at 'No auth header for picture upload', crates/routes/src/images.rs:97:6`, but that seems like a problem with lemmy-ui (using latest main branch).

candidates.title: Rework websocket
candidates.body:
This is a continuation of #2593. I decided to move all the code for receiving websocket requests into the top-level crate, so that there is a logical control flow without having to pass function pointers around. However I ran into some problems with the websocket actor code, which doesnt support async and requires weird workarounds. So i ripped all that out and replaced it with normal method calls. This is much easier to understand, and probably also more performant due to removing all these indirections. 

Its worth emphasizing that `actix` doesnt support async (evidenced by usage of `ThreadRng`), so it probably limited the performance. The current code also serializes structs to json and then deserializes again, even for basic calls like `GetUsersOnline`. Clearly very inefficient.

I removed some of the tracing code during rewrite, not sure how that should be added back.

Btw this uses `actix-ws` crate from @asonix now :)

candidates.title: Refactor crates for parallel build
candidates.body:
This change decouples the code in `api`, `api_crud` and `routes` crates from `apub`, so that they can all be compiled in parallel. This saves a lot of time for incremental builds, especially when making changes to database code. In my tests after running `cargo clean -p lemmy_utils`, build time is reduced from 115s to 71s. 

This required some refactoring and moving code around. In particular, some API handlers had to be moved to lemmy_apub, because they require apub types to work. I also had to add a SendActivity trait, so that activities dont have to be sent directly from api handlers, but generically from the top-level crate.

Before:
![Screenshot_20221129_164404](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1044450/204575529-51b83575-5d9c-4ceb-b8b9-6f81cfe9e731.png)

After:
![Screenshot_20221129_164411](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1044450/204575675-1aab8424-b8fe-4db4-a6ec-2614948645a3.png)

candidates.title: Update doku dependency for easier formatting of defaults.hjson
Live reload settings (fixes #2508)
candidates.body:
Todo:
- test that it actually works (needs working lemmy-ui version)
- also update federation settings
- get rid of unwrap (difficult because `std::sync::MutexGuard<'_, RateLimit>` cannot be sent between threads safely`)

candidates.title: Use urlencoding for db url params (fixes #2532)
Make verify apub url function async
Enable lto, strip symbols via cargo.toml
candidates.body:
Thin lto doesnt have any effect on compile time in my tests, and should improve performance. So no reason to leave it disabled. Stripping symbols via cargo.toml might be slightly faster, and means one step less in docker builds.

We could also try full lto, but it doubles build time and i fear that ci might time out then.

candidates.title: Add diesel_async, get rid of blocking function
Moving settings to Database.
candidates.body:
- Moves many settings into the database. Fixes #2285
- Adds a local_site and instance table. Fixes #2365 . Fixes #2368
- Separates SQL update an insert forms, to avoid runtime errors.
- Adds TypedBuilder to all the SQL forms, instead of default.

A few more things:

- All sites, communities, and persons now are linked to an `instance_id`, which should make querying them easier, and opens up some possibilities for apub simplification.
- Adds an `instance` table, with a `domain: String` column. These are not checked or verified, since they could be "blocked" instances, or ones we've never connected to.
- Adds `allowlist` and `blocklist` tables that link to instance_ids . The `CreateSite` and `UpdateSite`, in addition to all the new local settings type columns, also now have `allowed_instances: Option<String>`, that's a comma-delimited list of instances. An empty string clears them.
- Adds migrations so that a `local_site` and `site` row will always exist, with a `site_setup` column used to decide whether its the first person creating the site.

@Nutomic Although most of the apub tests are passing, I'm sure that the way I added the `instance` table is incorrect. You might think of additional uses for it, such as adding a `verified` column. 

*You do not need to look over anything in this PR besides the apub stuff.*

candidates.title: Use compat mode when signing outgoing activities (fixes #1984)
candidates.body: This should fix federation with Pleroma, and maybe also solve problems with Peertube. Main change is here: https://github.com/LemmyNet/activitypub-federation-rust/commit/4d888b2c8eebcfda504f37d02a3441be85959849
